content: <?xml version="1.0"?> <rdf:RDF   xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"   xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"   xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"   xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/" >  <channel rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=KURDISHSTUDIES&v=1.0">  <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=KURDISHSTUDIES&v=1.0</dc:identifier>  <title>KURDISHSTUDIES List</title>  <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=KURDISHSTUDIES</link>  <description>KURDISHSTUDIES List Archives</description>  <dc:date>2015-03-04T09:18:07Z</dc:date>  <image rdf:resource="http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif"/>    <items>   <rdf:Seq>     <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;5ea5a8f1.1503"/> <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;81831224.1502"/> <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;ac815d60.1502"/>     </rdf:Seq>  </items>   </channel>  <image rdf:about="http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif">     <title>Powered by L-Soft's LISTSERV mailing list manager</title>     <link>http://www.lsoft.com/products/listserv-powered.asp</link>     <url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;5ea5a8f1.1503">   <title>Diaspora, the Internet and Social Capital </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;5ea5a8f1.1503</link>   <description> Chapter on &quot;Diaspora, the Internet and Social Capital&quot;<br><br>Abstract<br>This chapter focuses on the linkages between the internet and the concepts of social capital and diaspora. Drawing on two different research projects on the Kurdish community in London, the chapter examines the role of the internet and more specifically social media in building networks and accumulating social capital for the Kurdish community in the UK. It argues that the internet, particularly in the form of social media, contributes to the growth of social networks, social capital and a community\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds cultural and political participation within and across the nation state borders. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T09:17:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>janroj Keles</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;5ea5a8f1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;81831224.1502">   <title>Panel on "The Kurds in a Changing Middle East" </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;81831224.1502</link>   <description> Pembroke Politics, in collaboration with the Cambridge University Kurdish Society, warmly invite you to our very exciting panel on 'The Kurds in a Changing Middle East' on Wednesday 25th February.<br><br>The issues surrounding Kurdistan and Kurdish Unity have shot to prominence in recent years in light of the Arab Spring, the Syrian Civil War, and the rise of ISIS. Even more recently the battle for Kobani, and its eventual liberation by Kurdish forces, have dominated Western headlines. To discuss the future for Kurds in the Middle East we have panel made up of the following:<br>Falah Mustafa, Head of the [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T00:20:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>janroj Keles</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;81831224.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;ac815d60.1502">   <title>Recent articles on Kurds </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;ac815d60.1502</link>   <description> These articles may be of interest to you<br><br>The European Kurds rallying to fight IS<br>https://www.opendemocracy.net/opensecurity/janroj-yilmaz-keles/european-kurds-rallying-to-fight-is<br><br>http://www.fairobserver.com/region/middle_east_north_africa/a-kurdish-state-is-inevitable-36578/<br>A Kurdish State is Inevitable   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T14:05:12+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>janroj Keles</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=KURDISHSTUDIES;ac815d60.1502</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
